intro: Guapeba glomerata, commonly known as the clustered guapeba, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
